docs.title: Class: PhenotypeContext
docs.text:
A context-specific annotation qualifying how a phenotype manifests under particular conditions. Each context can specify a genetic context, demographic stratum, or disease subtype, along with frequency, severity, onset, and supporting evidence specific to that context.

When no context qualifier slots are set (no genetic_context, sex, population, age_range, or subtype), the context provides evidence for the overall/default frequency claim, addressing the evidence separation problem (issue #112).

URI: dismech:PhenotypeContext

 classDiagram
    class PhenotypeContext
    click PhenotypeContext href "../PhenotypeContext/"
      PhenotypeContext : age_range

      PhenotypeContext : evidence





        PhenotypeContext --> "*" EvidenceItem : evidence
        click EvidenceItem href "../EvidenceItem/"



      PhenotypeContext : frequency





        PhenotypeContext --> "0..1" Any : frequency
        click Any href "../Any/"



      PhenotypeContext : genetic_context





        PhenotypeContext --> "0..1" GeneticContext : genetic_context
        click GeneticContext href "../GeneticContext/"



      PhenotypeContext : notes

      PhenotypeContext : onset





        PhenotypeContext --> "0..1" OnsetDescriptor : onset
        click OnsetDescriptor href "../OnsetDescriptor/"



      PhenotypeContext : population

      PhenotypeContext : severity

      PhenotypeContext : sex





        PhenotypeContext --> "0..1" SexEnum : sex
        click SexEnum href "../SexEnum/"



      PhenotypeContext : subtype

docs.title: Slots
docs.text: Name Cardinality and Range Description Inheritance frequency 0..1  Any or FrequencyEnum or FrequencyQuantity direct severity 0..1  String direct onset 0..1  OnsetDescriptor Structured age of onset descriptor direct notes 0..1  String direct evidence * recommended EvidenceItem Evidence supporting the frequency, severity, or onset claims made in this spe... direct genetic_context 0..1  GeneticContext The genetic context under which this qualification applies direct sex 0..1  SexEnum Sex-specific stratum, if applicable direct population 0..1  String Population or cohort description (e direct age_range 0..1  String Age range or stratification, if applicable direct subtype 0..1  String direct

      decreased, abnormal)

    description: List of predicate-value pairs for formal post-composition. Allows
      OWL-like expressivity with controlled predicates (e.g., RO relations) and values.

      qualifiers

    alias: qualifiers
    owner: PhenotypeDescriptor
    domain_of:

    range: Qualifier

    inlined: true
    inlined_as_list: true

docs.title: Usages
docs.text: used by used in type used Descriptor qualifiers range Qualifier CellTypeDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier BiologicalProcessDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier AnatomicalEntityDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier ChemicalEntityDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier GeneDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier CellularComponentDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier ProteinComplexDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier AssayDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier TriggerDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier DiseaseDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier BiomarkerDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier GeneProductDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier HistopathologyFindingDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier LifeCycleStageDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier PhenotypeDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier InheritanceDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier TreatmentDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier RegimenDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier ExposureDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier EnvironmentDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier OrganismDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier HostDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier SampleTypeDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier CriteriaItem qualifiers range Qualifier ConditionDescriptor qualifiers range Qualifier

docs.title: Comments
docs.text:
• DEPRECATED - prefer explicit slots (located_in, laterality) for better constraints
  • Use for formal semantic relationships like "has_input some X"
  • Both predicate and value are Descriptors, allowing recursive composition
  • Predicate typically uses RO (Relation Ontology) terms

description: A descriptor for biological sample types (tissue and/or cell type)
from_schema: https://w3id.org/monarch-initiative/dismech
is_a: Descriptor
attributes:
  tissue_term:

  preferred_term:
    name: preferred_term
    description: The preferred human-readable term for this descriptor. This may be
      more specific or nuanced than the linked ontology term label when the ontology
      does not fully capture the desired granularity. Note that postcomposition using
      the modifier slot may be appropriate for capturing the semantics of the preferred
      term.

    alias: preferred_term
    owner: SampleTypeDescriptor

    required: true

      with the `term` object, but the description is more human-readable and may be
      used to communicate nuances not captured by the rigid standardization of the
      term object.
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/monarch-initiative/dismech
    rank: 1000
    alias: description

    - MechanisticHypothesis
    range: string

  term:

    from_schema: https://w3id.org/monarch-initiative/dismech
    rank: 1000
    alias: term
    owner: SampleTypeDescriptor
    domain_of:

    - TermMapping

    - GOEnrichmentTerm
    range: Term
    recommended: true
    inlined: true
  modifier:
    name: modifier

      decreased, abnormal)

      OWL-like expressivity with controlled predicates (e.g., RO relations) and values.

      qualifiers

    alias: qualifiers
    owner: SampleTypeDescriptor
    domain_of:

    range: Qualifier
    multivalued: true
    inlined: true
    inlined_as_list: true

      obligation_level: REQUIRED
      binds_value_of: id
  therapeutic_agent:
    name: therapeutic_agent
    description: The drug(s) or chemical agent(s) used in this treatment. Use when
      the MAXO term is generic (e.g., pharmacotherapy MAXO:0000058) but specific drugs
      are involved.
    comments:
    - Prefer CHEBI terms for specific drugs (e.g., CHEBI:15365 for aspirin)
    - Use NCIT for drug classes when specific CHEBI term unavailable

docs.title: Enum: TreatmentEffectEnum
docs.text:
How a treatment affects a pathophysiology mechanism node

URI: dismech:TreatmentEffectEnum

docs.title: Permissible Values
docs.text: Value Meaning Description INHIBITS None Blocks or decreases the mechanism (e ACTIVATES None Promotes or increases the mechanism (e MODULATES None Alters the mechanism without clear unidirectional effect BYPASSES None Works around the disrupted mechanism via an alternative pathway RESTORES None Restores normal function of a disrupted mechanism (e

docs.title: Slots
docs.text: Name Description treatment_effect How the treatment affects the targeted mechanism

docs.title: Schema Source
docs.text: • from schema: https://w3id.org/monarch-initiative/dismech

docs.title: LinkML Source
docs.text:
name: TreatmentEffectEnum
description: How a treatment affects a pathophysiology mechanism node
from_schema: https://w3id.org/monarch-initiative/dismech
rank: 1000
permissible_values:
  INHIBITS:
    text: INHIBITS
    description: Blocks or decreases the mechanism (e.g., TKI inhibiting constitutive
      kinase activity)
  ACTIVATES:
    text: ACTIVATES
    description: Promotes or increases the mechanism (e.g., enzyme replacement restoring
      a deficient pathway)
  MODULATES:
    text: MODULATES
    description: Alters the mechanism without clear unidirectional effect
  BYPASSES:
    text: BYPASSES
    description: Works around the disrupted mechanism via an alternative pathway
  RESTORES:
    text: RESTORES
    description: Restores normal function of a disrupted mechanism (e.g., gene therapy,
      enzyme replacement)

docs.title: Class: TreatmentMechanismTarget
docs.text:
Links a treatment to a specific pathophysiology mechanism node it targets. Enables reasoning about which downstream phenotypes should respond to therapy and why resistance may emerge when the causal chain shifts.

URI: dismech:TreatmentMechanismTarget

 classDiagram
    class TreatmentMechanismTarget
    click TreatmentMechanismTarget href "../TreatmentMechanismTarget/"
      TreatmentMechanismTarget : description

      TreatmentMechanismTarget : evidence





        TreatmentMechanismTarget --> "*" EvidenceItem : evidence
        click EvidenceItem href "../EvidenceItem/"



      TreatmentMechanismTarget : target

      TreatmentMechanismTarget : treatment_effect





        TreatmentMechanismTarget --> "0..1" TreatmentEffectEnum : treatment_effect
        click TreatmentEffectEnum href "../TreatmentEffectEnum/"

docs.title: Slots
docs.text: Name Cardinality and Range Description Inheritance target 1  String Name of the pathophysiology entry this treatment targets direct treatment_effect 0..1  TreatmentEffectEnum How the treatment affects the targeted mechanism direct description 0..1  String direct evidence * recommended EvidenceItem Evidence that this treatment targets this specific mechanism direct

docs.text: Name Description Modifies Slot ClinicalTrial A clinical trial relevant to treatment or research of a disease yes BiologicalProcessDescriptor A descriptor for biological processes, bindable to Gene Ontology (GO) no DifferentialDiagnosis A disease or condition that presents similarly to the focal disease and must ... yes AgentLifeCycleStage no FunctionalEffect no Mechanism no Subtype no CriteriaSet A named criteria grouping within a definition no Inheritance no SampleTypeDescriptor A descriptor for biological sample types (tissue and/or cell type) no TreatmentDescriptor A descriptor for treatments/medical actions, bindable to Medical Action Ontol... no AgentLifeCycle no ComorbidityHypothesis Mechanistic hypothesis for a comorbidity association, with rich text and embe... no BiomarkerDescriptor A descriptor for biomarkers, bindable to NCIT no UpstreamConditionHypothesis Hypothesized upstream condition that may explain both A and B no Definition A diagnostic or phenotype definition for the disease no CriteriaItem A criterion element (clinical feature, test result, imaging requirement) no ModelingConsideration no TriggerDescriptor A descriptor for triggers/causes no Stage no Descriptor Base class for structured descriptors that allow a preferred term, optional d... yes ChemicalEntityDescriptor A descriptor for chemical entities, bindable to CHEBI no Environmental An environmental factor, exposure, or context relevant to disease no Transmission no ConditionDescriptor A descriptor for a condition or disease, optionally bound to MONDO no GeneDescriptor A descriptor for genes, bindable to HGNC or other gene databases no CellularComponentDescriptor A descriptor for cellular components, bindable to GO cellular component no Treatment no LifeCycleStageDescriptor A descriptor for parasite life cycle stages, bindable to OPL no AnatomicalEntityDescriptor A descriptor for anatomical locations, bindable to UBERON no Phenotype no Disease no CellTypeDescriptor A descriptor for cell types, bindable to Cell Ontology (CL) no ProteinComplexDescriptor A descriptor for protein complexes that gene products participate in, bindabl... no HistopathologyFinding A histopathologic finding from microscopic examination of tissue yes GeneProductDescriptor A descriptor for gene products (proteins, fusion proteins, oncoproteins), bin... no HostDescriptor A descriptor for hosts in an infectious agent life cycle no Pathophysiology no CausalEdge A reference to a downstream effect or consequence in a causal relationship no AnimalModel no InfectiousAgent no EnvironmentDescriptor A descriptor for environmental contexts/settings, bindable to ENVO no AssayDescriptor A descriptor for assays, bindable to OBI no HistopathologyFindingDescriptor A descriptor for histopathologic findings, bindable to NCIT Morphologic Findi... no OrganismDescriptor A descriptor for organisms, bindable to NCBITaxon no MechanisticHypothesis Disease-level hypothesis metadata used to organize downstream causal edges in... no GOEnrichment GO enrichment results for an association signal no Dataset A reference to a publicly available omics or phenotype dataset yes PhenotypeDescriptor A descriptor for phenotypes, bindable to Human Phenotype Ontology (HP) no TreatmentMechanismTarget Links a treatment to a specific pathophysiology mechanism node it targets no Assay no InheritanceDescriptor A descriptor for inheritance patterns, bindable to HPO mode of inheritance te... no GeneticContext A structured description of a genetic context that modifies phenotype frequen... no EpidemiologyInfo no Variant no ExposureDescriptor A descriptor for exposure events, bindable to ECTO or XCO no DiseaseDescriptor A descriptor for the focal disease, bindable to MONDO no Diagnosis no RegimenDescriptor A descriptor for treatment regimens, bindable to NCIT no ComputationalModel A computational or in-silico model relevant to understanding disease mechanis... no

with evidence for an association signal no ComputationalModel A computational or in-silico model relevant to understanding disease mechanis... no

docs.title: Slot: histopathology
docs.text:
Histopathologic findings including microscopic morphology, architectural patterns, cellular features, growth patterns, and histologic grading.

URI: dismech:histopathology Alias: histopathology

docs.title: Applicable Classes
docs.text: Name Description Modifies Slot Disease no

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Range: HistopathologyFinding

  • Multivalued: True

docs.title: Comments
docs.text:
• Separate from phenotypes as these are tissue-level microscopic observations
  • Use NCIT Morphologic Finding (C35867) or Histologic Grade (C18000) terms
  • {'For cancer': 'includes grade, differentiation, growth patterns, necrosis'}
  • {'For other diseases': 'may include architectural changes, cellular infiltrates'}

docs.title: Schema Source
docs.text: • from schema: https://w3id.org/monarch-initiative/dismech

docs.title: Mappings
docs.text: Mapping Type Mapped Value self dismech:histopathology native dismech:histopathology

docs.title: LinkML Source
docs.text:
name: histopathology
description: Histopathologic findings including microscopic morphology, architectural
  patterns, cellular features, growth patterns, and histologic grading.
comments:
- Separate from phenotypes as these are tissue-level microscopic observations
- Use NCIT Morphologic Finding (C35867) or Histologic Grade (C18000) terms
- '{''For cancer'': ''includes grade, differentiation, growth patterns, necrosis''}'
- '{''For other diseases'': ''may include architectural changes, cellular infiltrates''}'
from_schema: https://w3id.org/monarch-initiative/dismech
rank: 1000
alias: histopathology
domain_of:
- Disease
range: HistopathologyFinding
multivalued: true
inlined: true
inlined_as_list: true

docs.title: Slot: phenotype_contexts
docs.text:
Context-specific qualifications of this phenotype's frequency, severity, or onset. Each context can optionally specify a genetic context, demographic stratum, or disease subtype. When no context qualifiers are set, provides evidence for the base frequency/severity claim (addressing the frequency-evidence separation problem).

docs.title: Slot: preferred_term
docs.text:
The preferred human-readable term for this descriptor. This may be more specific or nuanced than the linked ontology term label when the ontology does not fully capture the desired granularity. Note that postcomposition using the modifier slot may be appropriate for capturing the semantics of the preferred term.

URI: dismech:preferred_term Alias: preferred_term

docs.title: Applicable Classes
docs.text: Name Description Modifies Slot BiologicalProcessDescriptor A descriptor for biological processes, bindable to Gene Ontology (GO) no SampleTypeDescriptor A descriptor for biological sample types (tissue and/or cell type) no TreatmentDescriptor A descriptor for treatments/medical actions, bindable to Medical Action Ontol... no BiomarkerDescriptor A descriptor for biomarkers, bindable to NCIT no CriteriaItem A criterion element (clinical feature, test result, imaging requirement) no TriggerDescriptor A descriptor for triggers/causes no Descriptor Base class for structured descriptors that allow a preferred term, optional d... no ChemicalEntityDescriptor A descriptor for chemical entities, bindable to CHEBI no ConditionDescriptor A descriptor for a condition or disease, optionally bound to MONDO yes GeneDescriptor A descriptor for genes, bindable to HGNC or other gene databases no CellularComponentDescriptor A descriptor for cellular components, bindable to GO cellular component no LifeCycleStageDescriptor A descriptor for parasite life cycle stages, bindable to OPL no AnatomicalEntityDescriptor A descriptor for anatomical locations, bindable to UBERON no CellTypeDescriptor A descriptor for cell types, bindable to Cell Ontology (CL) no ProteinComplexDescriptor A descriptor for protein complexes that gene products participate in, bindabl... no GeneProductDescriptor A descriptor for gene products (proteins, fusion proteins, oncoproteins), bin... no HostDescriptor A descriptor for hosts in an infectious agent life cycle no EnvironmentDescriptor A descriptor for environmental contexts/settings, bindable to ENVO no AssayDescriptor A descriptor for assays, bindable to OBI no HistopathologyFindingDescriptor A descriptor for histopathologic findings, bindable to NCIT Morphologic Findi... no OrganismDescriptor A descriptor for organisms, bindable to NCBITaxon no PhenotypeDescriptor A descriptor for phenotypes, bindable to Human Phenotype Ontology (HP) no InheritanceDescriptor A descriptor for inheritance patterns, bindable to HPO mode of inheritance te... no ExposureDescriptor A descriptor for exposure events, bindable to ECTO or XCO no DiseaseDescriptor A descriptor for the focal disease, bindable to MONDO no RegimenDescriptor A descriptor for treatment regimens, bindable to NCIT no

docs.title: Slot: target_mechanisms
docs.text:
Pathophysiology mechanism nodes that this treatment targets or modulates. Links a treatment to specific steps in the disease's causal graph, enabling inference about which downstream phenotypes should respond to therapy.

URI: dismech:target_mechanisms Alias: target_mechanisms

docs.title: Applicable Classes
docs.text: Name Description Modifies Slot Treatment no

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Range: TreatmentMechanismTarget

  • Multivalued: True

docs.title: Comments
docs.text:
• Target names should match pathophysiology entry names in the same disease file
  • Complements target_phenotypes by explaining WHERE in the causal chain the drug acts
  • Analogous to DrugMechDB paths but anchored to dismech pathophysiology nodes

docs.title: Schema Source
docs.text: • from schema: https://w3id.org/monarch-initiative/dismech

docs.title: Mappings

  • Each phenotype can include ontology term references (HP)

descriptors that allow a preferred term, optional d... no ChemicalEntityDescriptor A descriptor for chemical entities, bindable to CHEBI yes ConditionDescriptor A descriptor for a condition or disease, optionally bound to MONDO yes GeneDescriptor A descriptor for genes, bindable to HGNC or other gene databases yes CellularComponentDescriptor A descriptor for cellular components, bindable to GO cellular component yes GOEnrichmentTerm GO term enrichment result with statistical metrics no LifeCycleStageDescriptor A descriptor for parasite life cycle stages, bindable to OPL yes ICD10CMMapping ICD-10-CM diagnosis code mapping yes AnatomicalEntityDescriptor A descriptor for anatomical locations, bindable to UBERON yes CellTypeDescriptor A descriptor for cell types, bindable to Cell Ontology (CL) yes ProteinComplexDescriptor A descriptor for protein complexes that gene products participate in, bindabl... yes GeneProductDescriptor A descriptor for gene products (proteins, fusion proteins, oncoproteins), bin... yes TermMapping Mapping from this disease entry to an external term or code yes HostDescriptor A descriptor for hosts in an infectious agent life cycle no EnvironmentDescriptor A descriptor for environmental contexts/settings, bindable to ENVO yes AssayDescriptor A descriptor for assays, bindable to OBI yes HistopathologyFindingDescriptor A descriptor for histopathologic findings, bindable to NCIT Morphologic Findi... yes OrganismDescriptor A descriptor for organisms, bindable to NCBITaxon yes ICD11FMapping ICD-11 Foundation diagnosis code mapping yes PhenotypeDescriptor A descriptor for phenotypes, bindable to Human Phenotype Ontology (HP) yes InheritanceDescriptor A descriptor for inheritance patterns, bindable to HPO mode of inheritance te... yes ExposureDescriptor A descriptor for exposure events, bindable to ECTO or XCO yes DiseaseDescriptor A descriptor for the focal disease, bindable to MONDO yes MondoMapping MONDO disease ontology mapping yes RegimenDescriptor A descriptor for treatment regimens, bindable to NCIT yes
